newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine court confirms charges against minister.
newsitem.headline: Argentine court confirms charges against minister.

text.p: An Argentine appeals court on Friday confirmed charges against former Defence Minister Oscar Camilion of failing in his duties and concealment linked to illegal arms sales, court officials said.

Camilion resigned as defence minister last July after a judge demanded his impeachment during investigations into the sale of Argentine arms to Ecuador during its brief jungle border war with Peru early in 1995.
Although no court has yet reached a verdict on charges that Camilion "failed in his duties as a public official" and of an alleged coverup, the former minister appealed against the charges.
A federal court confirmed the charges and also those against former air force chief Juan Paulik, prosecuting lawyer Ricardo Moner told Reuters.

Argentina was embarrassed by the discovery of the sale of 5,000 Argentine FAL rifles and 75,000 tons of ammunition to Ecuador. President Carlos Menem's government insisted the shipment in February 1995 was meant for Venezuela, but was diverted to the war zone without its knowledge.
